001package io.avaje.inject;
002
003import io.avaje.lang.NonNullApi;
004import io.avaje.lang.Nullable;
005
006import java.lang.annotation.Annotation;
007import java.lang.reflect.Type;
008import java.util.List;
009import java.util.Optional;
010
011/**
012 * Holds beans created by dependency injection.
013 * <p>
014 * The beans have singleton scope, support lifecycle methods for postConstruct and
015 * preDestroy and are created (wired) via dependency injection.
016 * </p>
017 *
018 * <h3>Create a BeanScope</h3>
019 * <p>
020 * We can programmatically create a BeanScope via {@code BeanScope.newBuilder()}.
021 * </p>
022 * <pre>{@code
023 *
024 *   // create a BeanScope ...
025 *
026 *   try (BeanScope scope = BeanScope.newBuilder()
027 *     .build()) {
028 *
029 *     CoffeeMaker coffeeMaker = context.get(CoffeeMaker.class);
030 *     coffeeMaker.makeIt()
031 *   }
032 *
033 * }</pre>
034 *
035 * <h3>External dependencies</h3>
036 * <p>
037 * We can supporting external dependencies when creating the BeanScope. We need to do 2 things.
038 * we need to specify these via
039 * </p>
040 * <ul>
041 *   <li>
042 *       1. Specify the external dependency via {@code @InjectModule(requires=...)}.
043 *       Otherwise at compile time the annotation processor detects it as a missing dependency and we can't compile.
044 *   </li>
045 *   <li>
046 *       2. Provide the dependency when creating the BeanScope
047 *   </li>
048 * </ul>
049 * <p>
050 * For example, given we have Pump as an externally provided dependency.
051 *
052 * <pre>{@code
053 *
054 *   // tell the annotation processor Pump is provided externally
055 *   // otherwise it thinks we have a missing dependency
056 *
057 *   @InjectModule(requires=Pump.class)
058 *
059 * }</pre>
060 * <p>
061 * When we build the BeanScope provide the dependency via {@link BeanScopeBuilder#withBean(Class, Object)}.
062 *
063 * <pre>{@code
064 *
065 *   // provide external dependencies ...
066 *   Pump pump = ...
067 *
068 *   try (BeanScope scope = BeanScope.newBuilder()
069 *     .withBean(Pump.class, pump)
070 *     .build()) {
071 *
072 *     CoffeeMaker coffeeMaker = context.get(CoffeeMaker.class);
073 *     coffeeMaker.makeIt()
074 *   }
075 *
076 * }</pre>
077 */
078@NonNullApi
079public interface BeanScope extends AutoCloseable {
080
081  /**
082   * Build a bean scope with options for shutdown hook and supplying external dependencies.
083   * <p>
084   * We can optionally:
085   * <ul>
086   *   <li>Provide external dependencies</li>
087   *   <li>Specify a parent BeanScope</li>
088   *   <li>Specify specific modules to wire</li>
089   *   <li>Specify to include a shutdown hook (to fire preDestroy lifecycle methods)</li>
090   *   <li>Use {@code forTesting()} to specify mocks and spies to use when wiring tests</li>
091   * </ul>
092   *
093   * <pre>{@code
094   *
095   *   // create a BeanScope ...
096   *
097   *   try (BeanScope scope = BeanScope.newBuilder()
098   *     .build()) {
099   *
100   *     CoffeeMaker coffeeMaker = context.get(CoffeeMaker.class);
101   *     coffeeMaker.makeIt()
102   *   }
103   *
104   * }</pre>
105   */
106  static BeanScopeBuilder newBuilder() {
107    return new DBeanScopeBuilder();
108  }
109
110  /**
111   * Return a single bean given the type.
112   *
113   * <pre>{@code
114   *
115   *   CoffeeMaker coffeeMaker = beanScope.get(CoffeeMaker.class);
116   *   coffeeMaker.brew();
117   *
118   * }</pre>
119   *
120   * @param type an interface or bean type
121   * @throws java.util.NoSuchElementException When no matching bean is found
122   */
123  <T> T get(Class<T> type);
124
125  /**
126   * Return a single bean given the type and name.
127   *
128   * <pre>{@code
129   *
130   *   Heater heater = beanScope.get(Heater.class, "electric");
131   *   heater.heat();
132   *
133   * }</pre>
134   *
135   * @param type an interface or bean type
136   * @param name the name qualifier of a specific bean
137   * @throws java.util.NoSuchElementException When no matching bean is found
138   */
139  <T> T get(Class<T> type, @Nullable String name);
140
141  /**
142   * Return a single bean given the generic type and name.
143   *
144   * @param type The generic type
145   * @param name the name qualifier of a specific bean
146   * @throws java.util.NoSuchElementException When no matching bean is found
147   */
148  <T> T get(Type type, @Nullable String name);
149
150  /**
151   * Optionally return a single bean given the type and empty if it is not found.
152   *
153   * @param type an interface or bean type
154   */
155  <T> Optional<T> getOptional(Class<T> type);
156
157  /**
158   * Optionally return a single bean given the type and name and empty if it is not found.
159   *
160   * @param type an interface or bean type
161   * @param name the name qualifier of a specific bean
162   */
163  <T> Optional<T> getOptional(Type type, @Nullable String name);
164
165  /**
166   * Return the list of beans that have an annotation.
167   *
168   * <pre>{@code
169   *
170   *   // e.g. register all controllers with web a framework
171   *   // .. where Controller is an annotation on the beans
172   *
173   *   List<Object> controllers = beanScope.listByAnnotation(Controller.class);
174   *
175   * }</pre>
176   *
177   * @param annotation An annotation class.
178   */
179  List<Object> listByAnnotation(Class<?> annotation);
180
181  /**
182   * Return the list of beans that implement the interface.
183   *
184   * <pre>{@code
185   *
186   *   // e.g. register all routes for a web framework
187   *
188   *   List<WebRoute> routes = beanScope.list(WebRoute.class);
189   *
190   * }</pre>
191   *
192   * @param interfaceType An interface class.
193   */
194  <T> List<T> list(Class<T> interfaceType);
195
196  /**
197   * Return the list of beans that implement the interface sorting by priority.
198   */
199  <T> List<T> listByPriority(Class<T> interfaceType);
200
201  /**
202   * Return the beans that implement the interface sorting by the priority annotation used.
203   * <p>
204   * The priority annotation will typically be either <code>javax.annotation.Priority</code>
205   * or <code>jakarta.annotation.Priority</code>.
206   *
207   * @param interfaceType The interface type of the beans to return
208   * @param priority      The priority annotation used to sort the beans
209   */
210  <T> List<T> listByPriority(Class<T> interfaceType, Class<? extends Annotation> priority);
211
212  /**
213   * Return all the bean entries from the scope.
214   * <p>
215   * The bean entries include entries from the parent scope if it has one.
216   *
217   * @return All bean entries from the scope.
218   */
219  List<BeanEntry> all();
220
221  /**
222   * Close the scope firing any <code>@PreDestroy</code> lifecycle methods.
223   */
224  void close();
225}
